p: Thymol (2-isopropyl-5-methylphenol) is a natural phenolic monoterpenoid extracted primarily from Thymus species ( Trachyspermum ammi (L.) Sprague) and other plant sources such as Baccharis Grisebachii Hieron. and Centipeda minima (L.) A. Br. & Asch. and widely used in pharmaceutical and food preservative applications. It is also obtained by various methods at industrial scale from m-cresol, or p-cymene and piperitone [ 13, 14, 15]. Thymol, a component of naturally occurring essential oils, exhibits multiple biological activities [ 5, 6]. It is antimicrobial [ 16, 17, 18, 19] and anti-inflammatory activity [ 20, 21], which means that it is suitable to heal wounds [ 22], antioxidative [ 23, 24], anticancer activity against human gastric cancer cells [ 25]. With its minimal potential toxicity, it shows a promise as a novel botanical pesticide [ 26].
